A line segment translated along a direction forming a 45-degree angle with it will intersect the original line segment only once at the point where the translation begins.

Rotating a north-pointing arrow 180 degrees clockwise around its tail will make the arrowhead point south.

When turning to the left, the right shoulder naturally moves forward to accommodate the turn.
When a person turns to their right, their left shoulder will be further back.
When turning to the left, the right shoulder will be further back.
